claim: The driver who set the Austrian Grand Prix Circuit lap record spent 20.761 seconds in the pit lane during that same race.
extra_info: lap record means the fastest time recorded which refers to time, how long spent at pitstop refers to duration
reasoning: Lewis Hamilton set the Austrian Grand Prix Circuit lap record (fastest lap time of 1:07.411 in the 2017 Austrian GP, raceId 977). In that same race, his pit stop duration was exactly 20.761 seconds, matching the claim precisely.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE circuits
(
    circuitId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    circuitRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name       TEXT default '' not null,
    location   TEXT,
    country    TEXT,
    lat        REAL,
    lng        REAL,
    alt        INTEGER,
    url        TEXT default '' not null
        unique
);

tool_use_result.stdout:

(
    circuitId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    circuitRef TEXT default '' not null,

    location   TEXT,
    country    TEXT,
    lat        REAL,

    alt        INTEGER,

content.content:
CREATE TABLE lapTimes
(
    raceId       INTEGER not null,
    driverId     INTEGER not null,
    lap          INTEGER not null,
    position     INTEGER,
    time         TEXT,
    milliseconds INTEGER,
    primary key (raceId, driverId, lap),
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE lapTimes
(
    raceId       INTEGER not null,
    driverId     INTEGER not null,
    lap          INTEGER not null,
    position     INTEGER,
    time         TEXT,
    milliseconds INTEGER,
    primary key (raceId, driverId, lap),
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId)
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE pitStops
(
    raceId       INTEGER not null,
    driverId     INTEGER not null,
    stop         INTEGER not null,
    lap          INTEGER not null,
    time         TEXT    not null,
    duration     TEXT,
    milliseconds INTEGER,
    primary key (raceId, driverId, stop),
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE pitStops
(
    raceId       INTEGER not null,
    driverId     INTEGER not null,
    stop         INTEGER not null,
    lap          INTEGER not null,
    time         TEXT    not null,
    duration     TEXT,
    milliseconds INTEGER,
    primary key (raceId, driverId, stop),
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId)
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE drivers
(
    driverId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    driverRef   TEXT default '' not null,
    number      INTEGER,
    code        TEXT,
    forename    TEXT default '' not null,
    surname     TEXT default '' not null,
    dob         DATE,
    nationality TEXT,
    url         TEXT default '' not null
        unique
);

tool_use_result.stdout:

        unique

content.text: The claim mentions "Austrian Grand Prix Circuit" - this likely refers to the circuit. Now I need to find the lap record (fastest lap time) across all races at these Austrian circuits. Let me find the fastest lap time and identify the driver, then check their pit stop duration in that same race.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" "SELECT lt.raceId, lt.driverId, lt.lap, lt.time, lt.milliseconds, d.forename, d.surname FROM lapTimes lt JOIN races r ON lt.raceId = r.raceId JOIN drivers d ON lt.driverId = d.driverId WHERE r.circuitId IN (23, 57, 70) ORDER BY lt.milliseconds ASC LIMIT 5"
input.description: Find fastest lap time at Austrian circuits

content.text: The fastest lap at the Austrian Grand Prix circuit was set by Lewis Hamilton (driverId=1) in race 977 (2017 Austrian Grand Prix) with a time of 1:07.411. Now let me check his pit stop duration in that same race.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" "SELECT * FROM pitStops WHERE raceId = 977 AND driverId = 1"
input.description: Find Hamilton's pit stops in 2017 Austrian GP

content.text:
The data shows:
- **Lap record holder**: Lewis Hamilton set the fastest lap at the Austrian Grand Prix circuit with 1:07.411 in the 2017 Austrian Grand Prix (raceId 977).
- **Pit stop duration**: In that same race, Hamilton had one pit stop with a duration of **20.761 seconds**.

The claim states the driver who set the lap record spent 20.761 seconds in the pit lane during that race, which exactly matches the data.

```json
{"label": "ENTAILED", "reasoning": "Lewis Hamilton set the Austrian Grand Prix Circuit lap record (fastest lap time of 1:07.411 in the 2017 Austrian GP, raceId 977). In that same race, his pit stop duration was exactly 20.761 seconds, matching the claim precisely."}
```
